sn2.23:1.1: The name serī here is from siri (“auspiciousness, good luck”). He does not appear elsewhere.
sn2.23:8.1: The moral of this story is echoed in SN 3.18:9.1.
sn2.23:8.2: Sharing wealth is a moral act. | Dīyittha is passive reflexive aorist of √dā.
sn2.23:8.10: “Dwindled” is paṭikkami, literally “went backwards”. This sense is also recorded for Sanskrit pratikram.
